options.fig-cap: The risk of developing adverse respiratory symptoms for volunteers assigned to clean wildlife is higher than that for those volunteers assigned to tasks which do not have direct exposure to oil.
options.label: unnamed-chunk-38

options.fig-cap: Model of the sampling distribution for the relative risk comparing volunteers assigned to clean wildlife to volunteers assigned to tasks not involving oil exposure.  The model was developed via bootstrapping using 50000 replications.
options.label: unnamed-chunk-39

options.fig-cap: Model of the null distribution for the relative risk comparing volunteers assigned to clean wildlife to volunteers assigned to tasks not involving oil exposure.  The null hypothesis assumed the two groups of volunteers had the same risk.  The null distribution was developed via bootstrapping using 50000 replications.
options.label: unnamed-chunk-40
